intro: Canthium tophamii, commonly known as Topham's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are simple and alternate. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
